title: Election 2012 exit polls : percentage of votes by income
summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting Barack Obama, and Mitt Romney. The y axis indicates the Percentage of votes and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Barack Obama is gradually increasing, Mitt Romney is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
The ranking of the lines from topmost to botommmost is as follows: 1. Barack Obama, and lastly, 2. Mitt Romney.
Overall across the Year, Barack Obama mostly maintained the highest Percentage of votes when compared to others with a mean value of 52.25, and it peaked at Under_30000.
The botommost line, Mitt Romney,  has a mean of 46.0, and peaked at 100000_or_more.
min_summary: You are viewing a chart of multi-line type with 2 lines denoting Barack Obama, and Mitt Romney. The y axis indicates the Percentage of votes and the x axis indicates Year.
Overall Barack Obama is gradually increasing, Mitt Romney is gradually decreasing,  throughout the Year
Throughout the period, Barack Obama generally had the highest Percentage of votes relative to others with an average of 52.25, and it reached its maximum at Under_30000 with a value of 63.0.
The botommost line, Mitt Romney,  has a mean of 46.0, and peaked at 100000_or_more.
